pesticide.PPE: Long-sleeved shirt and long pants; Chemical-resistant gloves made of barrier laminate, butyl rubber ≥ 14 mils, nitrile rubber ≥ 14 mils, neoprene rubber ≥ 14 mils, polyvinyl chloride (PVC) ≥ 14 mils, or Viton™ ≥ 14 mils; Shoes plus socks

Active_Ingredients.name: Mefenoxam
Active_Ingredients.mode_Of_Action: Phenylamide class, interferes with fungal RNA synthesis

Active_Ingredients.name: Thiabendazole
Active_Ingredients.mode_Of_Action: Methyl-benzimidazole carbamate class, disrupts β-tubulin assembly in mitosis

Active_Ingredients.name: Fludioxonil
Active_Ingredients.mode_Of_Action: Phenylpyrrole class, interferes with MAP/histidine protein kinase in osmotic signal transduction

Active_Ingredients.name: Sedaxane
Active_Ingredients.mode_Of_Action: Succinate dehydrogenase inhibitor (SDHI) carboxamide class, disrupts cellular respiration and energy generation

Active_Ingredients.name: Picarbutrazox
Active_Ingredients.mode_Of_Action: Tetra-zolyloximes class, not known to be cross-resistant with fungicides of different mode of action

Safety_Information.general_Info: Harmful if swallowed or absorbed through the skin. Avoid contact with skin, eyes, or clothing. Wash thoroughly with soap and water after handling, and before eating, drinking, chewing gum, using tobacco, or using the toilet. Remove and wash contaminated clothing before reuse.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Call a poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice. Have person sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to by a poison control center or doctor. Do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious person.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: For a medical emergency involving this product call: 1-866-944-8565

Application_Info.max_product_per_acre_per_season: Do not use more than 0.083 lb thiamethoxam; 0.004 lb fludioxonil; 0.0178 lb picarbutrazox; 0.052 lb mefenoxam or metalaxyl-containing products; 0.004 lb sedaxane; 0.15 lb thiabendazole per acre per calendar year
